personal.intro: Engineer by craft, builder by obsession. I design scalable backends, deploy cloud-natively, and integrate AI where it genuinely creates impact — not just where it sounds impressive.
personal.about: I'm Vardan Verma — a full-stack engineer with a focused approach to backend architecture, cloud infrastructure, and practical AI integration. I build primarily with Python, Django, Node.js, and FastAPI, and I treat every project with a DevOps-first mindset: containerized from day one, version-controlled, and shipped through automated CI/CD pipelines on AWS and GCP. Beyond writing code, I actively research and deploy LLMs, RAG pipelines, and multi-step AI agents into real production workflows — reducing manual overhead and enabling teams to move faster. I care about clean architecture, observable systems, and solutions that hold up under production load.

pipeline.title: Code Push
pipeline.description: Developer pushes code to GitHub repository. Branch protection rules ensure code review before merging to main.

pipeline.title: Actions Trigger
pipeline.description: GitHub Actions workflow is triggered automatically on push or pull request events to the main branch.

pipeline.title: Build & Test
pipeline.description: Automated tests run, linting checks execute, and the application is built. Failures block the pipeline immediately.

pipeline.title: Docker Image
pipeline.description: A production Docker image is built and pushed to Amazon ECR (Elastic Container Registry) with version tagging.

pipeline.title: Deploy to AWS
pipeline.description: The new image is deployed to AWS ECS/EC2 with zero-downtime rolling updates and CloudWatch monitoring enabled.

ai.summary: I don't just talk about AI — I ship it. From production RAG pipelines and LangChain-powered APIs to multi-step agents that replace entire manual workflows, AI is baked into how I build. It's an engineering discipline, not a demo.
useCases: Built a RAG-powered internal knowledge bot using LangChain + Pinecone, reducing L1 support queries by 40% within the first month of deployment.
Engineered a document intelligence pipeline using GPT-4o that classifies, extracts, and summarizes content from PDFs at scale — handling 10k+ documents per day.
Deployed autonomous AI agents that orchestrate end-to-end workflows: data ingestion → transformation → enrichment → Slack/email notification, eliminating ~12 hours of manual work per week.
Implemented context-aware chatbots with conversation memory and multi-tenant isolation, deployed behind a REST API with JWT auth and rate limiting.

projects.name: CloudOps Automation Suite
projects.description: A full-stack DevOps dashboard that provisions and tears down AWS infrastructure via Terraform, tracks real-time service health through CloudWatch, and triggers auto-scaling rules based on custom metric thresholds. Includes a cost analytics view and Slack alerting.

projects.name: AI Document Intelligence
projects.description: A scalable document processing API that uses GPT-4o to extract structured data, classify document types, and generate summaries from uploaded PDFs and images. Deployed serverlessly on AWS Lambda with S3-backed storage and async job queuing.

projects.name: RAG Knowledge Base API
projects.description: A production-ready Retrieval-Augmented Generation system with semantic vector search via Pinecone, sliding-window conversation memory, and full multi-tenant isolation. Exposed via a REST API secured with JWT, rate limiting, and per-tenant token tracking.

projects.name: E-Commerce Microservices Platform
projects.description: Modular e-commerce backend split across independent microservices for auth, product inventory, order management, and payment processing. Each service owns its own database, communicates via REST, and is independently deployable through GitHub Actions onto AWS ECS with Redis-backed session caching.
